newsitem.title: LEBANON: Beirut market makes strong start to week.
newsitem.headline: Beirut market makes strong start to week.

text.p: The Beirut Stock Exchange made a strong start to the week after public holidays on Monday with two of the three listed bank shares continuing a price rally amid heavy demand.
Newcomer Bank of Beirut rose to $3.5 from $3.375 bringing its spectacular rise since its April 11 debut to 61 percent over issue price.
Demand for BOB remained high at 1,207,095 but about half Wednesday's 2,543,875. Supply was 253,372 shares, all of which were sold.
"It was an excellent start," Deputy Manager at Beirut finance house Lebanon Invest Alain Balian told Reuters.
Financial markets closed on Thursday and Friday for the Moslem Eid al-Adha holiday.
Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce rose to $15.5 from $15.125 while Banque Audi was unchanged at $20.

Both shares were in heavy demand and dealers said this would sustain the rise in prices. Demand for BLC totalled 71,374 against a supply of 17,406 while demand for Audi was 50,642 shares against 21,000.
"Demand obviously still exceeds the supply in bank shares. Therefore a further price rise is expected," Balian said.
BLC and Banque Audi have jumped 38 percent and 33 percent respectively since they made their debuts on December 30 and January 20.
"The parameters are still the same as last week. There are still few alternatives to bank shares and more and more people will continue to get into the market," Balian added.
A block of 46,015 BOB shares traded on the floor at $3.5. A block of 772 BLC shares traded on the floor at $15. Another block of 20,806 BLC shares traded off the floor at the same price.
The LIBX bank index rose 2.05 percent to 133.78. The BLOM general index rose 0.07 percent to 914.19 and the LISPI rose 0.07 percent to 87.81.
Solidere A and B shares were unchanged at $10.25 and $10.75 respectively.
Eternit rose slightly to $2.0312 from $2.0 on turnover of 10,000 shares. Ciments Libanais was unchanged at $1.2812 on turnover of 20,000 shares.
Total BSE turnover was 451,342 shares compared with 340,813 shares on Wednesday. Value was $2,656,960 from $2,290,210.
There was no trade in Ciments Blancs and Uniceramic.
